body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
You documented [way of preparing](https://docs.temporal.io/docs/server/quick-install/) for Go SDK tutorial installs Cassandra on my laptop but it cannot hold it and stop responding. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Devs like me would like a small and neat Mysql version.
`docker-compose -f docker-compose-mysql.yml up`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
would https://github.com/temporalio/docker-compose/blob/e1914a32803d864d7482c9e7b0e25d1bb5709e98/docker-compose-mysql.yml be a nice default? 

**Additional context**
I cannot take a screenshot, I waited 5 minutes to stop "CTRL+C" command to get accepted. 16 Gb Ram, Linux, all that was free, 6Gb Ram got eaten by a hungry hog Cassandra! :-1:

comments.body:
have you tried https://github.com/temporalio/docker-compose?
there is one for mysql + ES setup: https://github.com/temporalio/docker-compose/blob/main/docker-compose-mysql-es.yml

> have you tried https://github.com/temporalio/docker-compose?
> there is one for MySQL + ES setup: https://github.com/temporalio/docker-compose/blob/main/docker-compose-mysql-es.yml

Hey @wxing1292 
Is Elastic necessary for Go SDK tutorial? I presume not.
elastic search should not be required for basic use case

title: Document a default way to run tutorial with MySQL DB, not Cassandra.
